abstracts.cdata!:
The agriculture sector is predominant in
            the national economy of Cameroon. The Agricultural Extension
            & Research Program Support Project was created to
            increase the agricultural production of small-scale farmers,
            to initiate agricultural extension services that would be
            respective of specific provincial environments, and to
            finance education in order to produce more agricultural
            extension specialists. The project was also designed to
            strengthen the links between research and agricultural
            extension services. This environmental assessment lists
            these environmental risks: (i) increased toxins through the
            improper use of chemical products, namely non-organic
            pesticides and fertilizers; (ii) water pollution caused by
            the improper use of such chemical products; (iii)
            atmospheric pollution caused by fires on land set aside for
            agricultural use; (iv) nutritional negligence caused by
            farmers selling all of their produce and not reserving
            sufficient amounts to address nutritional needs; (v)
            deforestation caused by expansion of farm lands into forest
            areas; and (vi) threats to biodiversity through the use of
            pesticides. It is hope that these risks will be mitigated
            through education on the use of pesticides and fertilizers,
            the engendering of respect for the environment, and the need
            to create food reserve for small-scale farmers.
